p: Similarly, Schilte et al. [ 25] studied 180 patients with CHIKV arthritis of 36 months duration in whom the hands, wrists, ankles, and knees were most affected. Around 60%–80% of the patients had intermittent arthritis, while arthritis was unremitting in 20%–40%. Among 173 patients with CHIKV evaluated at 27.5 months, Essackjee et al. [ 33] reported that 78.6% had persistent musculoskeletal symptoms and 5% met the American College of Rheumatology/European League Against Rheumatism (ACR/EULAR) criteria for RA.
